issue.title: Video rendering support
issue.body:
We currently don't have a specific use case for this, but I think it would be nice for react-native-skia to support video rendering. Especially as this could provide the possibility to apply blurs on top of video content, and make for example;
- fancy custom video controls 
- full-screen looping video as a backdrop for an app with blurring components on top of it

Also, this could eliminate the need of adding an extra library such as react-native-video, when react-native-skia is already part of your project. This could be practical if you just want some basic video rendering.

Some related code files I found in the Skia source which might be helpful;
[Skia video decoder](https://github.com/google/skia/blob/main/gm/video_decoder.cpp)
[Skia video decoder ffmpeg](https://github.com/google/skia/blob/main/experimental/ffmpeg/SkVideoDecoder.cpp)

comment.body:
I need to render a video from Skia animation. 
I just learned a little about ffmpeg-kit-react-native, it seems I have to save the entire image frame as a file and execute `FFmpeg commands` by providing image paths. This seems suboptimal because there is only a slight change between frames. Hopefully Skia can support video rendering more effectively.

issue.title: iOS: Add support for Fabric / new architecture
issue.body: Since we're now on version 0.68 of the example project we should add support for the new architecture / Fabric in our library as well. This should be done so that we can use the library both with and without Fabric.

comment.body:
I think skia is the last blocker for our app to use the new architecture. Unfortunately I have no cpp experience so I'm unlikely to be able to meaningfully contribute to solving this in the near term. Hopefully the talented people here will be able to tackle this soon 😄 

@chrfalch I see there's a PR already open for this, is there a blocker to merging that?

issue.title: docs: add animated gradient tutorial
issue.body:
The purpose of this Pull Request is to add the "Animated Gradient with React Native Skia" tutorial to the existing list. 

I'll be honest, I love this package and I made this tutorial just so I could finally open this Pull Request 😅

issue.title: Error Running React Native Skia in Solito Repo: Can't Resolve 'react-native-reanimated/package.json'
issue.body:
### Description

I'm encountering an issue while trying to run React Native Skia in the Solito repository for both mobile and web. Mobile seems to work fine, but I'm running into a problem on the web platform, which is also causing issues during the Next.js build. I hope someone can provide some guidance on resolving this issue.

```
warn ../../node_modules/@shopify/react-native-skia/lib/module/external/reanimated/moduleWrapper.js
Module not found: Can't resolve 'react-native-reanimated/package.json' in '/Users/apple/Documents/chessingly-frontend/node_modules/@shopify/react-native-skia/lib/module/external/reanimated'
```

issue.title: Android Bundle and APK crash in some devices

comment.body: Hi @quicksilverr, the problem has been solved by upgrading to the last version of React Native but I'm not 100% sure cause another developer does it. By the way, after that, the crash disappears.

issue.title: 0.1.125: Value is undefined, expected a String
Skia values gone from docs
issue.body:
### Description

Is this intentional that the [values](https://github.com/Shopify/react-native-skia/pull/1867/commits/b5e6a366618d1212ae53b86dfd2a144858681e37) page has been removed ? Is skia moving away from using its own computedValue and useValue to just use reanimated 3/2 ? Will selector work with reanimated values maybe some exaple out there ?

issue.title: Skia values gone from docs
issue.body:
### Description

Is this intentional that the [values](https://github.com/Shopify/react-native-skia/pull/1867/commits/b5e6a366618d1212ae53b86dfd2a144858681e37) page has been removed ? Is skia moving away from using its own computedValue and useValue to just use reanimated 3/2 ? Will selector work with reanimated values maybe some exaple out there ?

comment.body:
Good evening William, and thank you for the quick response!

It's great to see some simplification! I guess selectors might not be necessary indeed. I was planning on using them for a bar chart, where each bar is its own path/rect and needs to be colored, updated, and animated independently. However, I am pretty sure it can also be done without needing a selector by creating a custom component called 'Bar', where each has its own shared values.

issue.title: Memory Leak on Android

comment.body: @LeviWilliams We would love to have a look at an example if you have one. In the meantime, I will try to reproduce the issue from @walterholohan if possible.

issue.title: Memory Leak on Android

comment.body:
+1 here, after bumping our Skia version from 0.1.197 to 0.1.212 we started experiencing significant lag and unresponsiveness in some cases on Android only.

We do not use BoxShadow, only Shadow. We also do not conditionally render any Shadow's, we only change their properties.

issue.title: Skia values gone from docs
issue.body:
### Description

Is this intentional that the [values](https://github.com/Shopify/react-native-skia/pull/1867/commits/b5e6a366618d1212ae53b86dfd2a144858681e37) page has been removed ? Is skia moving away from using its own computedValue and useValue to just use reanimated 3/2 ? Will selector work with reanimated values maybe some exaple out there ?

comment.body:
Hello Roland 🙋🏼‍♂️

Indeed we are moving from Skia Animations to Reanimated. 
We will soon throw a deprecation warning on Skia animations and then remove them completely from the project.

We don't think selectors are needed at all but let us know if you would like us to look at your specific use-case and how to solve it. I'm curious to see it.

issue.title: Skia values gone from docs
issue.body:
### Description

Is this intentional that the [values](https://github.com/Shopify/react-native-skia/pull/1867/commits/b5e6a366618d1212ae53b86dfd2a144858681e37) page has been removed ? Is skia moving away from using its own computedValue and useValue to just use reanimated 3/2 ? Will selector work with reanimated values maybe some exaple out there ?

issue.title: Gradle sync throwing error
issue.body:
### Description

After installing React native skia getting this error while Gradle sync

CMake Error: The following variables are used in this project, but they are set to NOTFOUND.
Please set them or make sure they are set and tested correctly in the CMake files:
FBJNI_LIBRARY
linked by target "reactskia" in directory /Users/siyahulhaq/Development/mmnt/node_modules/@shopify/react-native-skia/android
JSI_LIB
linked by target "reactskia" in directory /Users/siyahulhaq/Development/mmnt/node_modules/@shopify/react-native-skia/android
REACT_LIB
linked by target "reactskia" in directory /Users/siyahulhaq/Development/mmnt/node_modules/@shopify/react-native-skia/android
TURBOMODULES_LIB
linked by target "reactskia" in directory /Users/siyahulhaq/Development/mmnt/node_modules/@shopify/react-native-skia/android


### Version

0.1.139

### Steps to reproduce

- initialize react native app
- install react native skia
- open project in android studio
- wait sync the project 
- will throw the error

### Snack, code example, screenshot, or link to a repository

"dependencies": {
    "@react-navigation/native": "^6.0.11",
    "@react-navigation/stack": "^6.2.2",
    "@reduxjs/toolkit": "^1.8.4",
    "@shopify/react-native-skia": "^0.1.139",
    "react": "18.0.0",
    "react-native": "0.69.3",
    "react-native-gesture-handler": "^2.5.0",
    "react-native-reanimated": "^2.9.1",
    "react-native-safe-area-context": "^4.3.1",
    "react-native-screens": "^3.15.0",
    "react-redux": "^8.0.2",
    "redux": "^4.2.0"
  },

comment.body: Same issue here and I am using windows 10

pull_request.body:

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view
Maintainer changes

This version was pushed to npm by hoxyq, a new releaser for react-devtools-core since your current version.


[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=react-devtools-core&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=4.27.1&new-version=4.28.4)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/Shopify/react-native-skia/network/alerts).
